column4: Has anyone tried Linspire ?  I am wondering if its something  I could set up on my wifes computer and have her use it, she is pretty noobish.
I use it on my laptop.  It's nice.
I think Ubuntu is better for me but for a non-technical person who just wants to be able to use it, linspire is better.

Check this out, to install any programs in Linspire you browse the site http://www.linspire.com/lindows_products_categories.php  and find the program you want (most have good descriptions and screenshots) and click the little running-man icon.  It's that easy.
